Mission¶

class orbitpy.mission.Mission(epoch=None, duration=None, spacecraft=None, propagator=None, grid=None, groundStation=None, settings=None, outputInfo=None, _id=None)[source]¶

Class to handle mission initialization and execution.

Usage:

mission = orbitpy.Mission.from_json(mission_json_str)
mission.execute()
Variables

  • startDate (float) – Mission epoch in Julian Date UT1.

  • duration (float) – Mission duration in days.

  • spacecraft (list, orbitpy.util.Spacecraft) – List of spacecraft in the mission.

  • propagator (orbitpy.propagator.J2AnalyticalPropagator) – Orbit propagator.

  • grid (list, orbitpy.grid.Grid or None) – List of grid objects to be used in case of coverage calculations.

  • groundStation (list, orbitpy.util.GroundStation or None) – List of ground-stations in the mission.

  • settings (orbitpy.mission.settings) – Mission settings. Refer to the Settings.from_dict(.) method for the default values.

  • outputInfo (list, output-info object) – List of output-info objects produced after execution of a OrbitPy function, e.g. orbitpy.propagator.PropagatorOutputInfo, orbitpy.propagator.ContactFinderOutputInfo, etc.

  • _id (str) – Unique identifier.

Methods Documentation

__init__(epoch=None, duration=None, spacecraft=None, propagator=None, grid=None, groundStation=None, settings=None, outputInfo=None, _id=None)[source]¶

Initialize an entity.

Parameters

  • _type (str) – (default: “Entity”)

add_constellation_from_dict(constel_dict, spc_bus_dict=None, instru_dict=None)[source]¶

Parse the spacecrafts in the input constellation and add them to the list of spacecrafts (instance variable spacecraft). A common spacecraft-bus and instrument(s) can also be specified.

Parameters

  • constel_dict (dict) – Dictionary with the constellation specifications.

  • spc_bus_dict (dict) – Dictionary with the spacecraft-bus specifications.

  • instru_dict (list,dict or dict) – Dictionary (or list of dictionaries) with the instrument specifications.

add_coverage_grid_from_dict(grid_dict)[source]¶

Add coverage grid(s) from the input dictionary. Update the output-info instanace variable. Auto-grids shall be generated in the execute_coverage_calculator function.

Parameters

grid_dict (dict or list, dict) – Dictionary with the grid specifications. Grid can be of type ‘autoGrid’ or ‘customGrid’. Refer to orbitpy.grid.Grid.from_autogrid_dict and orbitpy.grid.Grid.from_customgrid_dict for description of the expected key/value pairs of the dictionary.

add_groundstation_from_dict(d)[source]¶

Add one or more ground-stations to the list of ground-stations (instance variable groundStation).

Parameters

d (list, dict or dict) – Dictionary or list of dictionaries with the ground-station specifications.

add_instrument_to_spacecraft(new_instru, sensor_to_spc)[source]¶

Add instrument to the given list of spacecrafts.

Parameters

  • new_instru (instrupy.base.Instrument) – New instrument.

  • sensor_to_spc (list) – Unique IDs of spacecrafts to which the instrument is to be attached.

add_spacecraft_from_dict(d)[source]¶

Add one or more spacecrafts to the list of spacecrafts (instance variable spacecraft).

Parameters

d (list, dict or dict) – Dictionary or list of dictionaries with the spacecraft specifications.

clear()[source]¶

Re-initialize.

execute()[source]¶

Execute a mission where all the spacecrafts are propagated, (field-of-regard) coverage calculated for all spacecraft-instrument-modes, ground-station contact-periods computed between all spacecraft-ground-station pairs and intersatellite contact-periods computed for all possible spacecraft pairs.

Note

In case of GRID COVERAGE calculation, the field-of-regard is used (and not the scene-field-of-view). In case of SAR instruments and coverage calculations involving grid (i.e. GRID COVERAGE and POINTING OPTIONS WITH GRID COVERAGE), only the access at the middle of a continuous access interval is shown (see Correction of access files for purely side-looking instruments with narrow along-track FOV).

Returns

Mission output info as an heterogenous list of output info objects from propagation, coverage and contact calculations.

Return type

list, orbitpy.propagate.PropagatorOutputInfo, orbitpy.coveragecalculator.CoverageOutputInfo, orbitpy.contactfinder.ContactFinderOutputInfo

execute_archived()[source]¶

Execute a mission where all the spacecrafts are propagated, (field-of-regard) coverage calculated for all spacecraft-instrument-modes, ground-station contact-periods computed between all spacecraft-ground-station pairs and intersatellite contact-periods computed for all possible spacecraft pairs.

Note

In case of GRID COVERAGE calculation, the field-of-regard is used (and not the scene-field-of-view). In case of SAR instruments and coverage calculations involving grid (i.e. GRID COVERAGE and POINTING OPTIONS WITH GRID COVERAGE), only the access at the middle of a continuous access interval is shown (see Correction of access files for purely side-looking instruments with narrow along-track FOV).

Returns

Mission output info as an heterogenous list of output info objects from propagation, coverage and contact calculations.

Return type

list, orbitpy.propagate.PropagatorOutputInfo, orbitpy.coveragecalculator.CoverageOutputInfo, orbitpy.contactfinder.ContactFinderOutputInfo

execute_coverage_calculator()[source]¶

Execute coverage calculation for all the spacecrafts in the mission. The coverage-calculation type is indicated in the settings instance variable. Orbit propagation for all spacecrafts should be executed prior to this operation. The outputInfo instance variable shall be referred to locate the state files produced from orbit propagation. The results are written in the same folder as that of the spacecraft-state files. The output-info instance variable is updated. The list of output-info objects associated with this execution is returned.

execute_datametrics_calculator()[source]¶

Execute datametrics calculation for all the spacecrafts in the mission. Orbit propagation and coverage calculation for all spacecrafts should be executed prior to this operation. The outputInfo instance variable shall be referred to locate the state and access files produced by orbit propagation and coverage calculations. The results are written in the same folder as that of the spacecraft-state files. The output-info instance variable is updated. The list of output-info objects associated with this execution is returned.

execute_eclipse_finder()[source]¶

Find eclipse times for the spacecrafts in the mission. Orbit propagation for all spacecrafts should be executed prior to this operation. The outputInfo instance variable shall be referred to locate the state files produced from orbit propagation. The results are written in the same folder as that of the spacecraft-state files. The output-info instance variable is updated. The list of output-info objects associated with this execution is returned.

execute_groundstation_contact_finder()[source]¶

Find contacts between spacecrafts and ground-stations in the mission. Orbit propagation for all spacecrafts should be executed prior to this operation. The outputInfo instance variable shall be referred to locate the state files produced from orbit propagation. The results are written in the same folder as that of the spacecraft-state files. The output-info instance variable is updated. The list of output-info objects associated with this execution is returned.

execute_intersatellite_contact_finder()[source]¶

Find contacts between spacecrafts in the mission. Orbit propagation for all spacecrafts should be executed prior to this operation. The outputInfo instance variable shall be referred to locate the state files produced from orbit propagation. The list of output-info objects associated with this execution is returned.

execute_propagation()[source]¶

Execute orbit propagation for all spacecrafts in the mission. The list of output0info objects associated with this execution is returned.

static from_dict(d)[source]¶

Parses an Mission object from a normalized JSON dictionary.

Parameters

d (dict) – Dictionary with the mission specifications.

Returns

Mission object.

Return type

orbitpy.mission.Mission

Note

Either of the constellation, instrument json objects or the spacecraft json object should be provided in the mission specifications. Both should not be specified.

Note

The valid key/value pairs in building the mission specifications json/ dict is identical to the key/value pairs expected in the obtaining the corresponding OrbitPy objects using the from_dict or from_json function.

Note

The propagation time step-size if not specified is calculated from the list of available spacecraft and propagation time-resolution factor. If no spacecraft, 60s is the assumed step-size.

Note

The grid-resolution if not specified is calculated from the list of available spacecraft and grid-resolution factor. If no spacecraft, 1 deg grid-resolution is assumed.

classmethod from_json(json_doc)¶

Parses an entity from a JSON-formatted string, dictionary, or file.

get_spacecraft_orbit_specs()[source]¶

Get the Keplerian elements of the orbit of the spacecraft(s).

Returns

List of namedtuple objects with the following entries: <spacecraft-id, sma, ecc, inc, raan, aop, ta> Angles are in radians.

Return type

list, namedtuple

Save auto-grid data to file.

Returns

Mission object as python dictionary.

Return type

dict

Serializes this entity to a JSON-formatted string or file.

update_coverage_settings_from_dict(d)[source]¶

Update the coverage settings.

Parameters

d (dict) –

Dictionary with the coverage settings. Expected key/value pairs are:

  • coverageType: Type of coverage calculation.

  • gridResFactor: Factor which influences the grid-resolution of an auto-generated grid. See orbitpy.grid.compute_grid_res.

update_duration(duration)[source]¶

Update the instance variable epoch from input dictionary of date specifications.

Parameters

d (dict) – Dictionary with the date specifications.

update_epoch_from_dict(d)[source]¶

Update the instance variable epoch from input dictionary of date specifications.

Parameters

d (dict) – Dictionary with the date specifications.

update_propagator_settings(prop_dict, propTimeResFactor=None)[source]¶

Update the propagator settings.

Parameters

  • prop_dict (dict) – Dictionary with the specifications of the orbit propagator. See the orbitpy.propagator module for available propagators and their descriptions.

  • propTimeResFactor (float) – Factor which influences the propagation step-size calculation. See orbitpy.propagator.compute_time_step.

update_settings(outDir=None, coverageType=None, propTimeResFactor=None, gridResFactor=None, opaqueAtmosHeight=None, midAccessOnly=None)[source]¶

Update settings.

Parameters

  • outDir (str) – Output directory path.

  • coverageType (str or None) – Type of coverage calculation.

  • propTimeResFactor (float) – Factor which influences the propagation step-size calculation. See orbitpy.propagator.compute_time_step.

  • gridResFactor (float) – Factor which influences the grid-resolution of an auto-generated grid. See orbitpy.grid.compute_grid_res.

  • opaqueAtmosHeight (float) – Relevant in-case of inter-satellite communications. Height of atmosphere (in kilometers) below which line-of-sight communication between two satellites cannot take place. Default value is 0 km.

  • midAccessOnly (bool) – Flag to have only the access-times at the middle of access-intervals. The flag is set to True when coverage calculations are done for narrow FOV instruments like SAR or pushbroom-optical sensors using a sceneFOV (or FOR defined by a sceneFOV). See Correction of access files for purely side-looking instruments with narrow along-track FOV.
